column4: hey if  i have 653 megs of ram, is there any way to tell why swap space is being used?
megs of free ram
the 'free' command
I would say somthing paged out to swap and just hasent paged back yet.
from what ive read over the years.. its best to let linux handle the memory and not try to tweak it like people try to di with windoes.
enables the backports repository
is it a backport from jaunty to intrepid?
no idea.. could be in some cases I guess. but not always
i think that is what has messed up X for me
'updated unofficial, but desireable packages' is how i think of it.
in KDE or gnome its laggy?
yiou can always reinstall grep i imagine
yes, but synaptic was throwing all sorts of warnings
yep. that can happen when you start adding.remioveing repos and stuff. and why backports is considerd optional/unsupported.
yeah but i would think that removing the repo, then deleting orphaned packages should be smooth
when it was installing kde I saw it pulling in Xorg packages -- which is what i think my problem is
could be its using some older/veasa/whatever drivers instad of the ones you need for your system.
so how do i verify the versions and all that to get this thing working again?
not sure. You could try reinstalling your video card drivers i guess. Ive rarely had issues remioving things.. i rarely remove things.
X -version perhaps
somthing from 'ppa' would be very unofficial i think
so should i just reinstall xorg-server again?
could try i guess.   thats all we are doing here is guessing basically.
yeah what  i really wanted to do was somehow tell synaptic to go back to the latest supported packages across the board
